00031 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LQUOTA
00032 
00033 #include "qsd_internal.h"
00034 
00035 /*
00036  * Initialize qsd-specific fields of quota entry.
00037  *
00038  * \param lqe - is the quota entry to initialize
00039  * \param arg - is the pointer to the qsd_qtype_info structure
00040  */
00041 static void qsd_lqe_init(struct lquota_entry *lqe, void *arg)
00042 {
00043         LASSERT(!lqe_is_master(lqe));
00044 
00045         /* initialize slave parameters */
00046         rwlock_init(&lqe->lqe_lock);
00047         memset(&lqe->lqe_lockh, 0, sizeof(lqe->lqe_lockh));
00048         lqe->lqe_pending_write = 0;
00049         lqe->lqe_pending_req   = 0;
00050         init_waitqueue_head(&lqe->lqe_waiters);
00051         lqe->lqe_usage    = 0;
00052         lqe->lqe_nopreacq = false;
00053 }
00054 
00055 /*
00056  * Update a slave quota entry. This is done by reading enforcement status from
00057  * the copy of the global index and then how much is the slave currenly owns
00058  * for this user from the slave index copy.
00059  *
00060  * \param env - the environment passed by the caller
00061  * \param lqe - is the quota entry to refresh
00062  * \param arg - is the pointer to the qsd_qtype_info structure
00063  */
00064 static int qsd_lqe_read(const struct lu_env *env, struct lquota_entry *lqe,
00065                         void *arg)
00066 {
00067         struct qsd_thread_info *qti = qsd_info(env);
00068         struct qsd_qtype_info  *qqi = (struct qsd_qtype_info *)arg;
00069         int                     rc;
00070 
00071         LASSERT(!lqe_is_master(lqe));
00072 
00073         /* read record from global index copy to know whether quota is
00074          * enforced for this user */
00075         rc = lquota_disk_read(env, qqi->qqi_glb_obj, &lqe->lqe_id,
00076                               (struct dt_rec *)&qti->qti_glb_rec);
00077 
00078         switch(rc) {
00079         case -ENOENT:
00080                 /* no such entry, assume quota isn't enforced for this user */
00081                 lqe->lqe_enforced = false;
00082                 break;
00083         case 0:
00084                 if (qti->qti_glb_rec.qbr_hardlimit == 0 &&
00085                     qti->qti_glb_rec.qbr_softlimit == 0)
00086                         /* quota isn't enforced for this use */
00087                         lqe->lqe_enforced = false;
00088                 else
00089                         lqe->lqe_enforced = true;
00090                 break;
00091         default:
00092                 LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, "failed to read quota entry from global "
00093                              "index copy, rc:%d", rc);
00094                 return rc;
00095         }
00096 
00097         /* read record from slave index copy to find out how much space is
00098          * currently owned by this slave */
00099         rc = lquota_disk_read(env, qqi->qqi_slv_obj, &lqe->lqe_id,
00100                               (struct dt_rec *)&qti->qti_slv_rec);
00101         switch(rc) {
00102         case -ENOENT:
00103                 lqe->lqe_granted = 0;
00104                 break;
00105         case 0:
00106                 lqe->lqe_granted = qti->qti_slv_rec.qsr_granted;
00107                 break;
00108         default:
00109                 LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, "failed to read quota entry from slave "
00110                              "index copy, rc:%d", rc);
00111                 return rc;
00112         }
00113 
00114         /* don't know what the qunit value is yet */
00115         qsd_set_qunit(lqe, 0);
00116 
00117         /* read current disk-usage from disk */
00118         rc = qsd_refresh_usage(env, lqe);
00119         if (rc)
00120                 return rc;
00121 
00122         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "successfully read from disk");
00123         return 0;
00124 }
00125 
00126 /*
00127  * Print lqe information for debugging.
00128  *
00129  * \param lqe - is the quota entry to debug
00130  * \param arg - is the pointer to the qsd_qtype_info structure
00131  * \param msgdata - debug message
00132  * \param fmt     - format of debug message
00133  */
00134 static void qsd_lqe_debug(struct lquota_entry *lqe, void *arg,
00135                           struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata,
00136                           const char *fmt, va_list args)
00137 {
00138         struct qsd_qtype_info   *qqi = (struct qsd_qtype_info *)arg;
00139 
00140         libcfs_debug_vmsg2(msgdata, fmt, args,
00141                            "qsd:%s qtype:%s id:"LPU64" enforced:%d granted:"
00142                            LPU64" pending:"LPU64" waiting:"LPU64" req:%d usage:"
00143                            LPU64" qunit:"LPU64" qtune:"LPU64" edquot:%d\n",
00144                            qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_svname, QTYPE_NAME(qqi->qqi_qtype),
00145                            lqe->lqe_id.qid_uid, lqe->lqe_enforced,
00146                            lqe->lqe_granted, lqe->lqe_pending_write,
00147                            lqe->lqe_waiting_write, lqe->lqe_pending_req,
00148                            lqe->lqe_usage, lqe->lqe_qunit, lqe->lqe_qtune,
00149                            lqe->lqe_edquot);
00150 }
00151 
00152 /*
00153  * Vector of quota entry operations supported on the slave
00154  */
00155 struct lquota_entry_operations qsd_lqe_ops = {
00156         .lqe_init               = qsd_lqe_init,
00157         .lqe_read               = qsd_lqe_read,
00158         .lqe_debug              = qsd_lqe_debug,
00159 };
00160 
00161 int qsd_write_version(const struct lu_env *env, struct qsd_qtype_info *qqi,
00162                       __u64 ver, bool global)
00163 {
00164         struct qsd_instance *qsd = qqi->qqi_qsd;
00165         struct dt_object    *obj = global ? qqi->qqi_glb_obj :
00166                                             qqi->qqi_slv_obj;
00167         int                  rc;
00168         ENTRY;
00169 
00170         rc = lquota_disk_update_ver(env, qsd->qsd_dev, obj, ver);
00171         if (rc)
00172                 RETURN(rc);
00173 
00174         qsd_bump_version(qqi, ver, global);
00175         RETURN(0);
00176 }
00177 
00178 /*
00179  * Consult current disk space consumed by a given identifier.
00180  *
00181  * \param env   - the environment passed by the caller
00182  * \param qqi   - is the pointer to the qsd_qtype_info structure associated
00183  *                with the identifier.
00184  * \param lqe   - is the quota entry associated with the identifier
00185  */
00186 int qsd_refresh_usage(const struct lu_env *env, struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00187 {
00188         struct qsd_thread_info  *qti = qsd_info(env);
00189         struct lquota_acct_rec  *rec = &qti->qti_acct_rec;
00190         struct qsd_qtype_info   *qqi = lqe2qqi(lqe);
00191         int                      rc = 0;
00192         ENTRY;
00193 
00194         LASSERT(qqi->qqi_acct_obj);
00195 
00196         /* read disk usage */
00197         rc = lquota_disk_read(env, qqi->qqi_acct_obj, &lqe->lqe_id,
00198                               (struct dt_rec *)rec);
00199         switch(rc) {
00200         case -ENOENT:
00201                 lqe->lqe_usage = 0;
00202                 rc = 0;
00203                 break;
00204         case 0:
00205                 if (qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_is_md)
00206                         lqe->lqe_usage = rec->ispace;
00207                 else
00208                         lqe->lqe_usage = toqb(rec->bspace);
00209                 break;
00210         default:
00211                 LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, "failed to read disk usage, rc:%d", rc);
00212                 RETURN(rc);
00213         }
00214 
00215         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "disk usage: "LPU64, lqe->lqe_usage);
00216         RETURN(0);
00217 }
00218 
00219 /*
00220  * Update slave or global index copy.
00221  *
00222  * \param env    - the environment passed by the caller
00223  * \param qqi    - is the qsd_type_info structure managing the index to be
00224  *                 update
00225  * \param qid    - is the identifier for which we need to update the quota
00226  *                 settings
00227  * \param global - is set to true when updating the global index copy and to
00228  *                 false for the slave index copy.
00229  * \param ver    - is the new version of the index. If equal to 0, the version
00230  *                 of the index isn't changed
00231  * \param rec    - is the updated record to insert in the index file
00232  */
00233 int qsd_update_index(const struct lu_env *env, struct qsd_qtype_info *qqi,
00234                      union lquota_id *qid, bool global, __u64 ver, void *rec)
00235 {
00236         struct thandle          *th = NULL;
00237         struct dt_object        *obj;
00238         __u64                   *new_verp = NULL;
00239         int                      flags = 0;
00240         int                      rc;
00241         ENTRY;
00242 
00243         obj = global ? qqi->qqi_glb_obj : qqi->qqi_slv_obj;
00244 
00245         /* allocate transaction */
00246         th = dt_trans_create(env, qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_dev);
00247         if (IS_ERR(th))
00248                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(th));
00249 
00250         /* reserve enough credits to update record in index file */
00251         rc = lquota_disk_declare_write(env, th, obj, qid);
00252         if (rc)
00253                 GOTO(out, rc);
00254 
00255         /* start local transaction */
00256         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_dev, th);
00257         if (rc)
00258                 GOTO(out, rc);
00259 
00260         if (global) {
00261                 /* Update record in global index copy */
00262                 struct lquota_glb_rec *glb_rec = (struct lquota_glb_rec *)rec;
00263 
00264                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: updating global index hardlimit: "LPU64", "
00265                        "softlimit: "LPU64" for id "LPU64"\n",
00266                        qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_svname, glb_rec->qbr_hardlimit,
00267                        glb_rec->qbr_softlimit, qid->qid_uid);
00268         } else {
00269                 /* Update record in slave index copy */
00270                 struct lquota_slv_rec *slv_rec = (struct lquota_slv_rec *)rec;
00271 
00272                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: update granted to "LPU64" for id "LPU64
00273                        "\n", qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_svname, slv_rec->qsr_granted,
00274                        qid->qid_uid);
00275         }
00276 
00277         if (ver != 0) {
00278                 new_verp = &ver;
00279                 flags = LQUOTA_SET_VER;
00280         }
00281 
00282         /* write new record to index file */
00283         rc = lquota_disk_write(env, th, obj, qid, (struct dt_rec *)rec, flags,
00284                                new_verp);
00285         EXIT;
00286 out:
00287         dt_trans_stop(env, qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_dev, th);
00288         if (rc)
00289                 CERROR("%s: failed to update %s index copy for id "LPU64", rc:"
00290                        "%d\n", qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_svname,
00291                        global ? "global" : "slave", qid->qid_uid, rc);
00292         else if (flags == LQUOTA_SET_VER)
00293                 qsd_bump_version(qqi, ver, global);
00294         return rc;
00295 }
00296 
00297 /*
00298  * Update in-memory lquota entry with new quota setting from record \rec.
00299  * The record can either be a global record (i.e. lquota_glb_rec) or a slave
00300  * index record (i.e. lquota_slv_rec). In the former case, \global should be
00301  * set to true.
00302  *
00303  * \param env    - the environment passed by the caller
00304  * \param lqe    - is the quota entry associated with the identifier
00305  * \param global - is set to true when updating the record is of type
00306  *                 lquota_glb_rec. Otherwise, it is a lquota_slv_rec record.
00307  * \param rec    - is the updated record received from the master.
00308  */
00309 int qsd_update_lqe(const struct lu_env *env, struct lquota_entry *lqe,
00310                    bool global, void *rec)
00311 {
00312         ENTRY;
00313 
00314         LASSERT(lqe != NULL);
00315         LASSERT(!lqe_is_master(lqe));
00316 
00317         /* updating lqe is always serialized, no locking needed. */
00318         if (global) {
00319                 struct lquota_glb_rec *glb_rec = (struct lquota_glb_rec *)rec;
00320 
00321                 /* change enforcement status based on new hard/soft limit */
00322                 lqe->lqe_enforced = (glb_rec->qbr_hardlimit ||
00323                                      glb_rec->qbr_softlimit) ? true : false;
00324 
00325                 LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "updating global index hardlimit: "LPU64", "
00326                              "softlimit: "LPU64, glb_rec->qbr_hardlimit,
00327                              glb_rec->qbr_softlimit);
00328         } else {
00329                 struct lquota_slv_rec *slv_rec = (struct lquota_slv_rec *)rec;
00330 
00331                 lqe->lqe_granted = slv_rec->qsr_granted;
00332 
00333                 LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "updating slave index, granted:"LPU64"",
00334                              slv_rec->qsr_granted);
00335         }
00336 
00337         RETURN(0);
00338 }
